field.txt: J2ME Polish consists of an build-tool and an optional J2ME GUI which can be designed using the web-standard CSS.
Find more information about J2ME Polish at www.j2mepolish.org.

description.txt: Please specify the location of the Wireless Toolkit:

field.txt: Please note: when you enter an invalid location, you need to specify either the wtk.home-property or the preverify-attribute in the build.xml-file.
You have successfully installed J2ME Polish ${ Version }.
You can find the documentation in the "doc"-folder.
If you have installed the sample application, you can create your first MIDlet by calling Ant either from the command-line or from within your favorite Java IDE.
For migrating J2ME Polish into existing projects, just copy the file "build.xml" and the folder "import" to your project.
Remove the installation directory for de-installing J2ME Polish.
